DataElement.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Liver Disease Severity Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the severity of liver disease using the Charlson Comorbity Index.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Charlson Comorbidity Index Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder Severity
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score._A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver parenchyma and intrahepatic bile ducts. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and polycystic liver disease. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, lymphoma, and angiosarcoma._Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score.

Concepts.definition: A method of predicting mortality risk or disease burden for patients with specific comorbid conditions. The conditions are assigned a weight from 1 to 6, based on ICD diagnosis codes, and these weights are summed to produce a single comorbidity score.

Property.preferredName: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder Severity
Property.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver parenchyma and intrahepatic bile ducts. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and polycystic liver disease. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, lymphoma, and angiosarcoma.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.

Concepts.longName: Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Disorder
Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder that affects the liver parenchyma and intrahepatic bile ducts. Representative examples of non-neoplastic disorders include hepatitis, cirrhosis, cholangitis, and polycystic liver disease. Representative examples of neoplastic disorders include hepatocellular adenoma, hepatocellular carcinoma, intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, lymphoma, and angiosarcoma.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 11/13/20 Princess Margaret CDE request. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Intensely bad or unpleasant in degree, quality or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

Concepts.definition: Gentle or temperate in nature or degree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.
